intro: Acianthera iguapensis, commonly known as the Iguapé orchid, is a rare and endemic species native to the Amazon rainforest of Brazil. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers with intricate patterns. The plant typically grows as a terrestrial orchid, often found in shaded, humid environments near streams or in dense undergrowth. Its roots are specialized for nutrient absorption in poor soil conditions, and it plays a role in the ecological diversity of its habitat. Due to habitat loss, it is considered threatened and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
